questions.question_text:
The project manager is unable to obtain a global consensus of competing subject matter experts and stakeholders on the project scope. This has caused a one- month delay.
What should the project manager do next to reduce further delay?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B correct answer

choices.B: To ensure that project priorities are being appropriately factored into risk response plans.
choices.D: To determine where more attentive project leadership and organizational involvement is needed.
choices.C: To assign risks and risk severities to functional discipline and departments effectively.
choices.A: To enable the team in identifying the specific causes of risks associated with project objectives.

questions.question_text: A risk management professional is in the process of categorizing risks when a subject matter expert (SME) suggests categorizing the risks by their impact to the project objectives. Why should the risk management professional use this approach?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To present the risks that have the most impact on achieving project objectives, the risk manager should perform qualitative risk analysis, which prioritizes risks based on their probability of occurrence and impact on project objectives (such as scope, time, cost, or quality). This allows the risk manager to identify and rank the most significant risks to discuss with the project sponsor effectively. (Ref: The Standard for Risk Management Pg. 34)

questions.question_text:
After starting a new pipeline project, a risk manager schedules an initial meeting with the project sponsor. For the meeting, the project sponsor requests a presentation of the risks that have the most impact on achieving the project objectives.

What should the risk manager do to facilitate the sponsor’s ask?

discussion.content:

D is correct,

choices.D: Escalate this initiative to project decision makers and sponsors.

questions.question_text:
A two-year project with a budget of US$2 million has completed about 60% of the work at the end of the first year. The actual cost incurred to complete the remaining 40% of work is about US$1.5 million. As a part of performing a specialized risk analysis, the calculated schedule performance index (SPI) is 1.2 and cost performance index (CPI) is 0.53.

How should the risk manager interpret such a low CPI value?

choices.A: The cost control processes are not effective.
choices.B: There is a problem with the cost baseline.
choices.D: The cost related risks are not effectively managed.
choices.C: The actual reported costs are not accurate.
